formal_accuser.name: Procureur fiscal des Vosges
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: Following common report that Ysabel was a witch causing incurable illnesses

accused.name: Ysabel veuve de Nicolas Seguin (alias Colardote)
accused.spouse_name: Nicolas Seguin (alias Colardot Seguin), second husband; Gerardmer, first husband

confession.seduction_context: In fields lamenting loss of first husband, which had reduced her to extreme poverty
sabbat_activities: dancing back to back so witches shouldn't know one another

witnesses.name: Guennotte fille de Jean Louys
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Had made pilgrimage with Gauthine; neighbor

witnesses.name: Barthelemy fils de Jean Molen
witnesses.occupation: portier et guet à la porte des Maisonnelles
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: No prior relationship; Ysabel begged at his house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Barthelemy insulted Ysabel when she came to beg, calling her 'vieille genaulche' after hearing rumors in town
testimony.threat_quote: Barthelemin t'en patirez des grosses parolles que tu m'as dictes

witnesses.name: Alix femme à Estienne Baronel
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Daughter worked with Ysabel at wine harvest

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute during wine harvest - Ysabel threw 'hottes' at daughter Jeanne

witnesses.name: Claude Magister
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Ysabel lived in same house as son-in-law Jean Richard; grandfather of victim

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 8 days after Ysabel touched the baby's arm

timeline.subject: Ysabel
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires taken by Symon Sallet, juré des douze de la justice ordinaire de Neufchatel, on orders of maire Nicolas Lalleman, representing procureur fiscal des Vosges, following common report that she was a witch

timeline.subject: Ysabel
timeline.details: Confrontations following accusations made by Denyse veuve Anthoine Pottier (see witch 086). Ysabel denied all allegations with blasphemes et execrations

timeline.subject: Ysabel and Gauthine
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for question extraordinaire for mother, and that Gauthine be presentée à la question

timeline.subject: Ysabel and Gauthine
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Ysabel
timeline.details: Interrogations under torture. Ysabel confessed to seduction by Mre Persil, attending sabbat, taking daughter to sabbat, and causing deaths

timeline.subject: Ysabel and Gauthine
timeline.details: Ysabel renewed all previous confessions. Mother and daughter confronted; Gauthine declared mother had lost her mind

timeline.subject: Ysabel
timeline.details: Procureur general des Vosges orders execution of mother and torture of daughter

timeline.subject: Ysabel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves execution and torture

timeline.subject: Gauthine
timeline.details: Gauthine tortured four times but refused to admit anything, invoking God and Virgin Mary

timeline.subject: Gauthine
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders that she be renvoyée jusqu'à rappel. Change de Nancy agrees

prior_accusations.context: Made accusations that led to confrontations on 29 May 1598

notable_quotes.speaker: Guennotte (witness 1) reporting mother's advice
notable_quotes.french: puisque ceste mauvaise femme a heu tant de puissance sur toy, qu'ayant receu notre seigneur elle n'en pourroit plus avoir
notable_quotes.english: since this evil woman has had so much power over you, having received our lord she could have no more
notable_quotes.context: Mother telling Guennotte to take communion so Ysabel would lose power over her

notable_quotes.speaker: Ysabel to Guennotte
notable_quotes.french: que si elle luy donnoit cent escus qu'elle ne la scauroit guerir
notable_quotes.english: that even if she gave her a hundred escus she wouldn't know how to cure her
notable_quotes.context: Refusing to heal Guennotte when confronted

notable_quotes.speaker: Guennotte to Ysabel
notable_quotes.french: allons, allons nous plaindre nos deux je te feray brusler
notable_quotes.english: let's go, let's go complain together, I'll have you burned

notable_quotes.speaker: Barthelemy (witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: Qu'est ce que vient faire ceste vieille genaulche ceans
notable_quotes.english: What is this old witch doing here
notable_quotes.context: Insulting Ysabel when she came to beg, having heard rumors in town

notable_quotes.speaker: Ysabel to Barthelemy
notable_quotes.french: Barthelemin t'en patirez des grosses parolles que tu m'as dictes
notable_quotes.english: Barthelemy, you will suffer for the harsh words you have said to me
notable_quotes.context: Touching his hat as she left after being insulted

notable_quotes.speaker: Ysabel to Alix's daughter Jeanne during grape harvest
notable_quotes.context: Throwing hottes at Jeanne during quarrel

notable_quotes.speaker: Ysabel to sick Jeanne
notable_quotes.french: maulvaise garce tu mangerois bien si tu voullois, dis à ta mere en la touchant sur le col, qu'elle te face une bonne souppe et tu te porteras bien
notable_quotes.english: wicked girl you would eat well if you wanted, tell your mother while touching her on the neck, that she should make you good soup and you will be well
notable_quotes.context: Healing Jeanne after causing her illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Alix to Ysabel
notable_quotes.french: truye et caigne qu'elle luy feroit tantost une belle saulce chez le receveur Hondreville
notable_quotes.english: sow and bitch that she would soon make her a fine sauce at receiver Hondreville's
notable_quotes.context: Threatening Ysabel after daughter became ill

notable_quotes.speaker: Ysabel to Claude Magister's grandson's mother Anne
notable_quotes.french: Ho Anne, le bel enfant que voicy
notable_quotes.english: Oh Anne, what a beautiful child this is
notable_quotes.context: Admiring the baby before later causing its death

notable_quotes.speaker: Gauthine to Ysabel (her mother) during confrontation
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'avoit plus d'esprit ny d'entendement ains l'avoir perdu
notable_quotes.english: that she no longer had spirit or understanding but had lost it
notable_quotes.context: Gauthine claiming her mother had lost her mind during confrontation

notable_quotes.speaker: Ysabel replying to Gauthine
notable_quotes.french: que non, et qu'elle l'avoit aussy bon que Jamais, mais qu'il falloit dire verité
notable_quotes.english: that no, and that she had it as good as ever, but that she must tell the truth
notable_quotes.context: Ysabel insisting she was sane and must tell the truth

relationships.evidence_text: Ysabel veuve de Nicolas Seguin, alias Colardote
first marriage to Gerardmer had lasted six years
her father Gerardmer had been dead before her birth
Guennotte fille de Jean Louys tixerant
Daughter had married there; father-in-law Jean Richard

economic_context.details: Ysabel lived in extreme poverty as a beggar after being widowed twice. She survived by seasonal harvest work, spinning, and gathering wood. She admitted her poverty prevented her from seeking legal redress when called a witch. Before her first marriage she had been a servant ('chambriere') to a priest.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost appetite, developed little lumps on shoulder where touched, became swollen, throat became so swollen she could not talk, whole body swollen, passed out worms and a sangsue (leech)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: No quarrel, but Guennotte failed to bring alms to Ysabel at St. Chrestofle church
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: Multiple episodes: Monday after Saturday market encounter; that night after failing to bring alms; night after seeing Ysabel on church steps
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Touch on shoulder; sitting on church steps and making cryptic remark about cold

harms_catalog.harm_description: Pain in right side, feeling as if bearing a heavy weight, intermittent despite purging and bleeding by doctors
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Barthelemy insulted Ysabel, calling her 'vieille genaulche' when she came to beg
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Touched his hat while threatening him

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute during wine harvest; Ysabel threw hottes at Jeanne, striking her on shoulder
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Throwing hottes and saying 'Vien de par le diable'; later healed by touching on neck

harms_catalog.victim_name: Baby grandson of Claude Magister (Anne's child)
harms_catalog.harm_description: Right arm developed a boil that didn't respond to ointment for 3 months; then a bosse under armpit which became running sore; seemed to have something like an animal in stomach; died after several months
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 8 days after Ysabel touched baby's arm
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Touch on arm while making fuss of baby

material_culture.context: Guennotte was selling cabus at market when Ysabel approached her
Ysabel gave strawberries to Guennotte as healing gift
Ysabel gave a small oatcake she had made to Guennotte
Ysabel told Guennotte to put chalk in plate with water, mix together and drink as remedy
Guennotte gave a purse to Ysabel for her daughter as payment for healing
Guennotte gave a coiffe to Ysabel for her daughter as payment
Guennotte gave a couvresol to Ysabel for her daughter as payment
Ysabel brought old pieces of sheet to Barthelemy's mother to mend
Ysabel threw hottes at Jeanne during wine harvest quarrel
Nicolas went back to vines to look for his forgotten apron
Ysabel sent ambres to the sick baby through her daughter
Ysabel said even if given a hundred escus she couldn't cure Guennotte
Surgeon asked a florin to open the dead baby's stomach, which seemed excessive

spatial_references.context: Main location of trial; where Ysabel lived and begged; where witnesses lived
Pilgrimage destination where Guennotte and Gauthine went together, both afflicted 'du mal d'iceluy sainct'
Where Guennotte's father was stationed in the garrison
Where the King was coming to, and where Guennotte suggested she and Gauthine go to be touched and healed
Where Ysabel sat with other poor people and where Guennotte saw her sitting before the door
Where Guennotte went to confess; found Ysabel sitting on steps of entry
Gate where Barthelemy worked as porter and guard
Where Claude Magister normally lived (laboureur from Rouvre)
Street in Neufchatel where Jean Richard lived as vigneron; Ysabel also lived in this house
Where the 'juif medecin' (Jewish doctor) lived who Guennotte's father took her to see
Nearby village where Ysabel was native
Home of la Grande Jeannon, accomplice seen at sabbat
Church of eleven thousand virgins at Nancy, pilgrimage site Ysabel suggested for healing the baby
Where Guennotte sold cabus; where Ysabel encountered her; where confrontation happened
Where Ysabel was lamenting loss of first husband when seduced by Mre Persil
Where wine harvest took place; where Nicolas saw figures jumping; where Jeanne worked with Ysabel

historical_context.military_details: Guennotte's father (husband of her mother) was in the garrison at Montigny-le-Roy. Claude Magister and family had taken refuge at Neufchatel during 'late wars' and lived there 4-5 years.
economic_hardship_indicators: Ysabel lived in extreme poverty as beggar after widowhood
Ysabel couldn't afford to seek legal redress when called witch
Surgeon's fee of one florin considered excessive by Claude Magister

legal_context.redress_outcome: Ysabel admitted that her poverty had prevented her from seeking redress when called a witch

hearsay_chains.content: Daughter believed Ysabel responsible for baby's death given her reputation
Daughter told mother she thought illness was Colardote's doing

emotional_state_notes: Went off murmurant parmy ledit marché
Said she wished she had already been burned
Gauthine invoked God and Virgin Mary during torture
Gauthine said she was innocent and God knew it

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Called Barthelemy 'ung jeune esvente et menteur' (a young scatterbrain and liar), unworthy of credit

third_parties.name: Jean Louys
third_parties.context: Weaver, bourgeois of Neufchatel; took Guennotte to see Ysabel and threatened to have her burned

third_parties.name: Mother of Guennotte
third_parties.context: Went to garrison at Montigny-le-Roy; conjectured Ysabel responsible for daughter's illness; advised daughter to seek communion

third_parties.name: Wife of Jean des Voages
third_parties.context: Ysabel told Guennotte this woman had been as bad but recovered

third_parties.name: Juif medecin of Remonville
third_parties.context: Jewish doctor whose remedies did no good for Guennotte, leading father to believe Ysabel responsible

third_parties.name: Jean Molen (father of Barthelemy)
third_parties.context: Went to see Ysabel but she said she couldn't heal his son; threatened to beat her and have her burned

third_parties.name: Mother of Barthelemy
third_parties.context: Ysabel brought old pieces of sheet for her to mend

third_parties.name: Sister of Barthelemy
third_parties.context: Was in good health when Ysabel came to house

third_parties.name: Jeanne daughter of Alix
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Worked with Ysabel at wine harvest
third_parties.context: Became ill after quarrel with Ysabel during grape picking; vomited continually; cured by Ysabel

third_parties.name: Estienne Baronel
third_parties.context: Worked for receveur Hondreville

third_parties.name: Receveur Hondreville
third_parties.context: Alix threatened to make Ysabel 'une belle saulce chez le receveur Hondreville'

third_parties.name: Anne daughter of Claude Magister
third_parties.context: Mother of baby who died; married Jean Richard; lived at father's house

third_parties.name: Jean Richard
third_parties.context: Vigneron who lived in rue St. Marie

third_parties.name: Baby grandson of Claude Magister
third_parties.context: Died after Ysabel touched his arm; developed boil, then running sore under armpit, seemed to have animal in stomach

third_parties.name: Surgeon
third_parties.context: Asked a florin to open dead baby's stomach, which seemed excessive so they didn't proceed

third_parties.name: Didier Giaguier
third_parties.context: Father of Nicolas

third_parties.name: Denyse veuve Anthoine Pottier
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: Made accusations against Ysabel; seen at sabbat
third_parties.context: See witch 086; her accusations led to confrontations on 29 May 1598

third_parties.name: la Grande Jeannon de Rebeufville
third_parties.context: Named as accomplice seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: Gerardmer
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: First husband of Ysabel, father of Gauthine
third_parties.context: Died before Gauthine's birth; first marriage lasted 6 years

third_parties.name: Priest of the town
third_parties.context: Ysabel had been 'chambriere' (servant) to a priest before her first marriage

third_parties.name: Mre Persil
third_parties.context: Seduced Ysabel 18 years before (circa 1580) when she was in fields lamenting loss of first husband and her poverty

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a dual trial of mother Ysabel and daughter Gauthine. Ysabel was executed after confessing under torture. Gauthine was tortured four times but never confessed and was released (renvoyée jusqu'à rappel). The trial shows a pattern of healing magic - Ysabel both caused and cured illnesses. Witness 1 (Guennotte) died before confrontations. The trial began in August 1596 but confrontations didn't occur until May 1598, suggesting connection to another trial (w086, Denyse). Economic poverty is central to Ysabel's story - widowed twice, reduced to begging, unable to afford legal redress. Multiple witnesses threatened to have Ysabel burned. The case shows community belief in her power to both harm and heal.
